page.title: 07 THORLEY RESIDENTS' VIEWS
page.content: Shoppers at the Sainsbury centre in the new western suburb of Stortford were asked about their origins & views on the district.All had migrated to Thorley whithin the last 5 years,some from London,others from places as distant as Sheffield & Dublin.Their husbands are all London commuters.All purchase groceries at the local hypermarket,reached on foot or by car.For higher order goods ie.furniture they travel to Harlow or Cambridge.They like the modern housing & think the area is safe.Most intend to stay indefinitely in spite of the lack of amenities & recreational facilities.The nearest theatre,cinima & bingo halls are at Harlow.There is no post office,bank, school,church or hall on the estate.
